comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: NYT of October 9, 1915 select.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=F60612F73A5C1373... is about early bomb-dropping tests by the U.S. Navy "in a Burgess-Dunne seaplane equipped with a gyromotor." See www.canadianwings.com/Aircraft/aircraftDetail.php?DUNNE-197 and de.wikipedia.org/wiki/Burgess-Dunne_AH-7 (in German) for more on the plane and en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Burgess_Company for info on the U.S. company that built the plane under license from John Dunne, the British designer. I'm not expert enough to judge if it's exactly the same model, but someone thinks so. See commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:Burgess-Dunne_AH-7_seapla...
